es.unizar.eina.notepadv3

Class NotesDbAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.unizar.eina.notepadv3.NotesDbAdapter

  • public class NotesDbAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple notes database access helper class. Defines the basic CRUD operations for the notepad example, and gives the ability to list all notes as well as retrieve or modify a specific note. This has been improved from the first version of this tutorial through the addition of better error handling and also using returning a Cursor instead of using a collection of inner classes (which is less scalable and not recommended).

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public NotesDbAdapter open()
                    throws android.database.SQLException
        Open the notes database. If it cannot be opened, try to create a new instance of the database. If it cannot be created, throw an exception to signal the failure
        Returns:
        this (self reference, allowing this to be chained in an initialization call)
        Throws:
        android.database.SQLException - if the database could be neither opened or created

      • close

        public void close()

      • createNote

        public long createNote(java.lang.String title,
                       java.lang.String body)
        Create a new note using the title and body provided. If the note is successfully created return the new rowId for that note, otherwise return a -1 to indicate failure.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the note
        body - the body of the note
        Returns:
        rowId or -1 if failed

      • deleteNote

        public boolean deleteNote(long rowId)
        Delete the note with the given rowId
        Parameters:
        rowId - id of note to delete
        Returns:
        true if deleted, false otherwise

      • fetchAllNotes

        public android.database.Cursor fetchAllNotes()
        Return a Cursor over the list of all notes in the database
        Returns:
        Cursor over all notes

      • fetchNote

        public android.database.Cursor fetchNote(long rowId)
                                  throws android.database.SQLException
        Return a Cursor positioned at the note that matches the given rowId
        Parameters:
        rowId - id of note to retrieve
        Returns:
        Cursor positioned to matching note, if found
        Throws:
        android.database.SQLException - if note could not be found/retrieved

      • updateNote

        public boolean updateNote(long rowId,
                          java.lang.String title,
                          java.lang.String body)
        Update the note using the details provided. The note to be updated is specified using the rowId, and it is altered to use the title and body values passed in
        Parameters:
        rowId - id of note to update
        title - value to set note title to
        body - value to set note body to
        Returns:
        true if the note was successfully updated, false otherwise
